intro: Freycinetia ellipticifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves that are elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky or sandy soils. Freycinetia ellipticifolia is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions.
